content:
I found the following that provides a nice checklist of things we need for publication (and I think we are in good shape on these checklist items):
https://wiki.hl7.org/FHIR_Implementation_Guide_Publishing_Requirements

However, it does not really give a "So, you are ready to publish, do these steps!" - anyone aware of such a thing?

OK, I did find this:
https://wiki.hl7.org/Process_for_Publishing_a_FHIR_IG

It seems I don't have the necessary permissions, so not sure where to go from here. I feel I am simply missing some documentation somewhere?

And I figured if I kept digging around, I would find it:
https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=40740908

Hmm, comments on this statement listed as a Dependency to the first step:

"Content of IG must be at FMM level 2 (if publishing as STU) or FMM level 5 (Normative) prior to submission of publication request "

FMM level 2 says this:
"FMM 2 PLUS the artifact has been tested and successfully supports interoperability among at least three independently developed systems leveraging most of the scope (e.g. at least 80% of the core data elements) using semi-realistic data and scenarios based on at least one of the declared scopes of the artifact (e.g. at a connectathon). These interoperability results must have been reported to and accepted by the FMG"
mCode, ELIMU, Geisenger? We did it in the past I'd ask Llyod and maybe Gil. as I recall Implementation Guides for FHIR have a different criteria for publishing. @Lloyd McKenzie

There have been several connectathons on the genetic stuff, I believe? Do you feel that you've exercised most of the stuff you're bringing forward? (Technically, the requirement for FMM2 is a requirement for going to ballot, not publishing, and it was introduced after you went to ballot, so doesn't really apply anyhow.)
Yes we tested the IG at 5+ Connectathons, this won't be the final version. But i think it is stabel/evolved enough to publish the current version
Thanks for all the responses everyone. Will move forward with the request once we are done, but wanted everyone to know in case we are asked for proof of the FMM 2.
I pushed the IG version to 0.4 (last release was 0.3), after this publication we should directly push to 0.5 to avoid confusion. What do you think?
I am not sure what the right version # is honestly, was going to ask that when we make the submission request.
1.0 has a nice ring to it ;)
OK - the question of the year. Do we feel we are ready? @James Jones @Patrick Werner ?
I'm making a last check at all the pages

Good list to check against here:
https://wiki.hl7.org/FHIR_Implementation_Guide_Publishing_Requirements
http://www.hl7.org/fhir/uv/genomics-reporting/history.cfml doesn't list version...
is that an exception? the header looks totally different, also the text mentions veterinary still
Yup, that is what my last commit fixed. Or tried to. That page is generated from our 'package-list.json' file, and I think it only gets updated when we publish.
we link to it from our navbar but yeah, seems like it is a special case
Okay I think I understand this now. Once Bret resolves the broken anchor in queries and we fix the margins on index.html I would say it is ready to put up on the fridge
broken anchor ? i can't find the problem yet
doesn't look like any <a> tags are bad. maybe need to escape some character?
It looks like we may have to actually declare one
ok.
looking at the source for the rendered page, it's generating a link: <a name="2.3"/>
may have to add in a <a name="IDqueries"></a>
where?
right before <h4>Variant ID based query</h4>. Not sure why it's needed, publisher is weird
I guess each header needs an anchor, so if we don't tell it where it just takes the next element?
need to wait for compile
OK, I think everything should be good. Any other changes?
None from me!
oops "specific instance of Obbsewrvation varaint."
Fix it :slight_smile:
done. I spelt checkd it

Fellow committers - I am going to be out of the office this afternoon and tomorrow. I might have some time to continue working on the document I shared with the list serv yesterday, but I am not sure how much time I will have. Would anyone else be willing/able to continue driving completing that document and moving it on?

@Patrick Werner / @James Jones / @Bret H ? ^^^ Anyone else would be welcome as well.

Sorry I didn't get this done before now.
I am around. We're not getting a good response yet. I think the document won't be ready till next week. But I am happy to add the information as it comes in. @Kevin Power
Thanks @Bret H
@Bret H - any progress on the document?
hey everyone. I'm almost healthy again. I'd like to support the document creation. Should we put the doc on google docs to avoid merge problems?
See here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1JHNwl2sqIC8G7qWwVhLjPXXuTfX8BNT-
btw - I think I made it editable for everyone now.

i can't edit it :-(
This is the link the doc inside google docs:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JHNwl2sqIC8G7qWwVhLjPXXuTfX8BNT-/edit
Yea, there is some weird formatting when using Google Docs to edit the Word document. You might have to download a copy, then re-upload?

FYI from Phillips @Alexander Mankovich synopsis: Phillips participated in Connecathon work bridging contents of their internal data model and the model as outlined in the IG for oncology reporting an output of this exercise is the oncology example in the somatic reporting section of the guide). @Kevin Power

Sorry did not have time to write this weekend. A bit impacted with surprises on pilot project and incoming projects.

Thanks @Alexander Mankovich and @Bret H - I have added this to the document and uploaded a new version:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JHNwl2sqIC8G7qWwVhLjPXXuTfX8BNT-/view
(bad idea deleted)
Yea, it messes with the layout so much, I decided not to convert it to a google doc.
If you access the link to the word doc, you can click the Download button to get get a local copy.
If you make some changes you want to upload, you can view the Drive folder its in: https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/1QyZYQymEkQRP6cG4VmAkPhw22MA-sEdD

Select the file, click on the 3 dots, and select Manage Versions. From there, you should see an option to UPLOAD NEW VERSION.

If you don't see that option, maybe I haven't fully enabled editing?
way better than my messed up solution
Good job. @Patrick Werner @James Jones @Kevin Power @ Bob Milius @l
